conclusion: To determine which container (E, F, or G) the liquid will flow into after passing through the baffles from points A, B, C, and D, we need to analyze the path of the liquid as it moves down the board.
Point A is on the left side.
Point B is slightly to the right of A.
Point C is further to the right.
Point D is on the far right.

premise: Liquid starts at point A and flows downward.
conclusion: Liquid from point A will flow into container E.

premise: Liquid starts at point B and flows downward.
conclusion: Liquid from point B will flow into container F.

premise: Liquid starts at point C and flows downward.
conclusion: Liquid from point C will flow into container G.

premise: Liquid starts at point D and flows downward.
conclusion: Liquid from point D will flow into container G.

premise: Final Answer: Liquid from point A will flow into container E. Liquid from point B will flow into container F. Liquid from points C and D will flow into container G.
conclusion: Most mixture of A, B and C end in container E; the other thin stream of C ends in container F; stream D ends in container G.
